intro: Theopsis lutchuensis, commonly known as the Luchuan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in well-drained soils. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
